title: Matthew John Armstrong
text:
Matthew John Armstrong (born August 28, 1973 in <a href="Chicago">Chicago</a>, <a href="Illinois">Illinois</a>, U.S.) is an American <a href="actor">actor</a>. He is known for roles in "Turks" (1999), "The Profile" (2010) and "Heroes" (2006).
Career.
He was most recently seen in the television series "<a href="Heroes%20%28U.S.%20TV%20series%29">Heroes</a>" as <a href="Ted%20Sprague">Ted Sprague</a> and a <a href="Hunting%20%28House%29">single episode</a> of "<a href="House%20%28TV%20series%29">House</a>". He also had a long-running role on "<a href="American%20Dreams">American Dreams</a>", and acted as a <a href="Phoenix%20%28mythology%29">phoenix</a> in one episode of "<a href="Supernatural%20%28U.S.%20TV%20series%29">Supernatural</a>". He attended <a href="Naperville%20Central%20High%20School">Naperville Central High School</a> in <a href="Naperville%2C%20Illinois">Naperville</a>, Illinois, where he played football and was the two-time Defensive Player of the Year in the DuPage Valley Conference. On May 4, 2012, he was recognised as a Naperville Central Alumni.
Cavemen misconception.
Armstrong reportedly has been mistaken as one of the actors who portray <a href="cavemen">cavemen</a> in a <a href="GEICO%20Cavemen">popular series of commercials</a> for the <a href="vehicle%20insurance">automobile insurance</a> provider <a href="GEICO">GEICO</a>, due to his hairstyle and facial hair resembling the makeup used for the caveman characters. Armstrong noted this misconception in an interview with "<a href="Entertainment%20Weekly">Entertainment Weekly</a>" stating, "For the record, I am not the GEICO caveman."
Personal life.
He is married to <a href="Ashley%20Crow">Ashley Crow</a>, the actress who portrayed <a href="List%20of%20characters%20in%20Heroes%23Sandra%20Bennet">Sandra Bennet</a> on "Heroes".
He has one son, <a href="Pete%20Crow-Armstrong">Pete Crow-Armstrong</a>, who was selected 19th overall in the <a href="2020%20Major%20League%20Baseball%20Draft">2020 Major League Baseball Draft</a> by the <a href="New%20York%20Mets">New York Mets</a>.
